sub_topic: Finding the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix
message_1:
Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the following matrix:

A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & -2 \\ 4 & -1 \end{bmatrix}
message_2:
To find the eigenvalues, we need to solve the characteristic equation, which is given by the determinant of (A - λI), where λ is the eigenvalue and I is the identity matrix.

A - λI = \begin{bmatrix} 3 - λ & -2 \\ 4 & -1 - λ \end{bmatrix}

The determinant of this matrix is:

(3 - λ)(-1 - λ) - (-2)(4) = λ^2 - 2λ - 7

To find the eigenvalues, we need to solve the quadratic equation:

λ^2 - 2λ - 7 = 0

Using the quadratic formula, we get:

λ = (2 ± √(2^2 - 4(-7))) / 2 = (2 ± √(52)) / 2

So, the eigenvalues are:

λ1 = (2 + √52) / 2
λ2 = (2 - √52) / 2

Now, we need to find the eigenvectors corresponding to each eigenvalue.

For λ1:

(A - λ1I)v1 = 0

\begin{bmatrix} 3 - (2 + √52) / 2 & -2 \\ 4 & -1 - (2 + √52) / 2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x1 \\ x2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}

Simplifying the matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} 1 - √52 / 2 & -2 \\ 4 & -3 - √52 / 2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x1 \\ x2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}

We can solve this system of equations to find the eigenvector v1:

x1 = (√52 / 2) * x2

So, the eigenvector v1 corresponding to λ1 is:

v1 = \begin{bmatrix} √52 / 2 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}

For λ2:

(A - λ2I)v2 = 0

\begin{bmatrix} 3 - (2 - √52) / 2 & -2 \\ 4 & -1 - (2 - √52) / 2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x1 \\ x2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}

Simplifying the matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} 1 + √52 / 2 & -2 \\ 4 & -3 + √52 / 2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x1 \\ x2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}

We can solve this system of equations to find the eigenvector v2:

x1 = (-√52 / 2) * x2

So, the eigenvector v2 corresponding to λ2 is:

v2 = \begin{bmatrix} -√52 / 2 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}

In summary, the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix A are:

λ1 = (2 + √52) / 2, v1 = \begin{bmatrix} √52 / 2 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}
λ2 = (2 - √52) / 2, v2 = \begin{bmatrix} -√52 / 2 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}
